Document.TEXT: Sensata Technologies Holding (ST) Set to Announce Earnings on Monday Posted by Jim Brewer on Jan 28th, 2016 // No Comments Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) is set to release its earnings data before the market opens on Monday, February 1st. Analysts expect Sensata Technologies Holding to post earnings of $0.65 per share for the quarter. Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, October 27th. The company reported $0.72 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $0.71 by $0.01. The business had revenue of $727.40 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $736.41 million. During the same period in the previous year, the business posted $0.63 EPS. Sensata Technologies Holding's revenue was up 26.0% compared to the same quarter last year. On average, analysts expect Sensata Technologies Holding to post $2.74 EPS for the current fiscal year and $3.01 EPS for the next fiscal year. In related news, VP Geert Braaksma sold 54,874 shares of the business's stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, November 3rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $49.29, for a total value of $2,704,739.46. Following the completion of the transaction, the vice president now directly owns 5,505 shares in the company, valued at approximately $271,341.45. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available through the SEC website . Also, SVP Martin J. Carter sold 66,000 shares of the business's stock in a transaction that occurred on Tuesday, November 17th. The shares were sold at an average price of $43.87, for a total value of $2,895,420.00. Following the completion of the transaction, the senior vice president now owns 38,080 shares of the company's stock, valued at $1,670,569.60. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Several analysts have weighed in on ST shares. Barclays boosted their price objective on Sensata Technologies Holding from $49.00 to $50.00 and gave the stock an overweight rating in a report on Tuesday, January 19th. RBC Capital boosted their price objective on Sensata Technologies Holding from $45.00 to $50.00 and gave the stock a sector perform rating in a report on Wednesday, October 28th. Citigroup Inc. cut Sensata Technologies Holding from a buy rating to a neutral rating in a report on Wednesday, October 7th. Zacks Investment Research raised Sensata Technologies Holding from a sell rating to a hold rating in a report on Wednesday, October 28th. Finally, SunTrust cut Sensata Technologies Holding from a buy rating to a neutral rating and dropped their price objective for the stock from $55.00 to $50.00 in a report on Friday, November 13th. Seven analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock presently has a consensus rating of Hold and a consensus price target of $53.00. Sensata Technologies Holding ( NYSE:ST ) opened at 36.38 on Thursday. The company has a market cap of $6.19 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 31.36. Sensata Technologies Holding has a 12 month low of $34.26 and a 12 month high of $55.53. The company's 50-day moving average is $41.58 and its 200 day moving average is $45.51. Sensata Technologies Holding N.V. is a global industrial technology company. The Company is engaged in the development, manufacture and sale of sensors and controls. The Company's operating segments include Sensors segment and Controls segment. The Company produce sensors and controls for applications such as thermal circuit breakers in aircraft, pressure sensors in automotive systems, and bimetal current and temperature control devices in electric motors. The Company's sensors are customized devices that translate a physical phenomenon, such as force or position, into electronic signals that microprocessors or computer-based control systems can act upon. Its controls are customized devices embedded within systems to protect them from heat or current. The Company's products include low-, medium- and high-pressure sensors, temperature sensors, speed sensors, position sensors, force sensors, motor protectors, and thermal and magnetic-hydraulic circuit breakers and switches.
